docs.title: Account Setup
docs.text: Get started with Raffl.online by creating your account and connecting your payment provider.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: • Sign Up – Create your Raffl.online account.

docs.title: Payment Integration
docs.text: • PayPal – Connect your PayPal account to receive payments.

docs.title: How to Connect Raffl.online to Your PayPal Account
docs.text: Raffl.online integrates directly with your PayPal account. To enable this integration, you’ll need your Paypal business email address, Client ID and Client Secret.

docs.title: Paypal Business Email Address
docs.text: The Paypal business email address is the primary address associated with the Paypal account. It is also typically used to log into Paypal.

docs.title: Retrieving your PayPal credentials
docs.text:
1. Go to the PayPal Developer Dashboard (Live) and log in with your PayPal account.
  2. Check if you already have an existing app listed.
    • If yes, click on the app name to view the Client ID and Client Secret.
    • You can send these credentials to me once located.
  3. If you don’t see an existing app:
    • Click “Create App”.
    • When prompted, select “Merchant” as the app type.
    • Enter a name for your app (e.g., “Raffl Integration”) and click “Create App”.
    • Once the app is created, you’ll be shown your Client ID and Client Secret.

⚠️ Make sure you are creating the app under the Live tab (not Sandbox), as Raffl.online uses live PayPal credentials.

docs.title: Creating Your Raffl.online Account
docs.text: Follow these steps to create a new Raffl.online account.

docs.title: Step 1: Go to the Sign Up Page
docs.text: Navigate to raffl.online/signup to access the registration form.

docs.title: Step 2: Enter Your Information
docs.text:
Fill out the registration form with the following:

  • Email Address – This will be your username for logging in.
  • Password – Must meet the requirements below.
  • Confirm Password – Re-enter your password to confirm.

docs.title: Password Requirements
docs.text:
Your password must:

  • Be at least 8 characters long
  • Include at least one uppercase letter
  • Include at least one lowercase letter
  • Include at least one number
  • Include at least one special character (e.g., !@#$%^&*)

docs.title: Step 3: Verify Your Email
docs.text:
After submitting the form:

  1. Check your email inbox for a verification message from Raffl.online.
  2. Click the verification link in the email.
  3. The link expires after 10 minutes, so verify promptly.

If you don't see the email, check your spam folder.

docs.title: Step 4: Verification Complete
docs.text: Once you click the verification link, your account is activated. You can now log in at raffl.online/admin using your email and password.

docs.title: Resending Verification Email
docs.text:
If your verification link expired or you didn't receive the email:

  1. Go to the sign up page.
  2. Click the link to resend the verification email.
  3. Enter your email address and submit.
  4. A new verification email will be sent.

docs.title: Raffles
docs.text: Create and manage raffles to sell tickets for your events and prizes.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
• Creating a Raffle – Set up a new raffle with custom ticket pricing and limits.
  • Viewing Raffles – See all your raffles and their public URLs.

docs.title: Managing Raffles
docs.text:
• Editing a Raffle – Update raffle details after creation.
  • Managing Entries – Add sponsors, view purchases, and manage tickets.

docs.title: Reference
docs.text: • How Purchases Work – Understand the purchase flow, fees, and entry limits.

docs.title: Creating a Raffle
docs.text:
1. In the top navigation bar, click Raffles.
  2. Click Create Raffle, then fill out the following fields:
    • Event Name (optional) – Name of the event associated with the raffle, if any.
    • Raffle Name – A short name describing the item being raffled (e.g., "Dog Blanket" or "Sculpture").
    • Description of Raffle (optional) – A more detailed description of the raffle item.
    • Ticket Cost – Price per ticket. Note: PayPal fees will be added during checkout.
    • Max Entries – Maximum number of tickets available for this raffle.
    • Unique URL Name (optional) – A custom URL for the raffle page. Leave blank to use the default.
  3. Click Create to publish the raffle.
  4. To see your raffle, click Raffles in the top navigation bar. The raffle’s live URL will appear in the URL column.

docs.title: Editing a Raffle
docs.text: You can modify an existing raffle's details at any time.

docs.title: Accessing the Edit Page
docs.text:
1. In the top navigation bar, click Raffles.
  2. Find the raffle you want to edit in the list.
  3. Click on the raffle name to open the edit page.

docs.title: Editable Fields
docs.text:
You can update the following fields:

  • Event Name – Name of the event associated with the raffle.
  • Raffle Name – A short name describing the item being raffled.
  • Description of Raffle – A more detailed description of the raffle item.
  • Ticket Cost – Price per ticket.
  • Max Entries – Maximum number of tickets available.
  • Unique URL Name – Custom URL for the raffle page.
  • Layout – Select a display template for your raffle page.

docs.title: Saving Changes
docs.text: Click Save to apply your changes. The updates will be reflected immediately on the public raffle page.

docs.title: How Raffle Purchases Work
docs.text: This page explains how participants purchase raffle entries and what happens during the process.

docs.title: Purchase Flow
docs.text:
1. Participant visits the raffle page – They see all available entries.
  2. Participant selects an entry – They click to claim a specific ticket number.
  3. Entry is held – The entry is marked as "pending" for 5 minutes while they complete payment.
  4. PayPal payment – The participant completes payment through PayPal.
  5. Entry confirmed – Once payment is received, the entry shows as purchased with the buyer's name.

docs.title: Entry Limits
docs.text: Participants can claim up to 6 entries per raffle. This prevents any single person from claiming too many entries.

docs.title: Pending Entries
docs.text:
When someone claims an entry, it's held for 5 minutes. During this time:

  • The entry appears as "pending" on the raffle page.
  • Other participants cannot claim that entry.
  • If payment isn't completed within 5 minutes, the entry becomes available again.

docs.title: PayPal Fees
docs.text:
The ticket price you set is the base cost. During checkout, PayPal fees are added automatically:

  • Fee calculation: 3.7% + $0.50 per transaction

For example, a $10 ticket would have a total cost of approximately $10.87 ($10 + $0.37 + $0.50).

docs.title: Buyer Information
docs.text: When an entry is purchased through PayPal, the buyer's name and email from their PayPal account are captured and associated with the entry. The buyer's name is displayed on the public raffle page.

docs.title: Managing Raffle Entries
docs.text: Once a raffle is created, you can manage individual ticket entries, including adding sponsors for tickets.

docs.title: Accessing Entry Management
docs.text:
1. In the top navigation bar, click Raffles.
  2. Click on the raffle name to open the edit page.
  3. Navigate to the Entries tab.

docs.title: Entry Types
docs.text:
Raffle entries can have different statuses:

  • Unclaimed – Available for purchase by participants.
  • Pending – A participant has claimed the entry and has 5 minutes to complete payment.
  • Purchased – The entry was purchased through PayPal. The buyer's name is displayed.
  • Sponsored – The entry was assigned a sponsor name by you (the admin).

docs.title: Adding Sponsors to Entries
docs.text:
You can manually assign sponsor names to entries. This is useful when someone pays outside of PayPal or when you want to reserve entries for sponsors.

  1. Find the entry number you want to sponsor.
  2. Enter the sponsor name in the field.
  3. Click Save to apply changes.

Sponsored entries will display the sponsor name on the public raffle page.

docs.title: Removing Sponsors
docs.text:
To remove a sponsor from an entry:

  1. Find the entry with the sponsor name.
  2. Clear the sponsor name field.
  3. Click Save.

The entry will return to an unclaimed state (unless it has a PayPal purchase associated).

docs.title: Deleting Entries
docs.text:
To remove an entry entirely:

  1. Locate the entry you want to delete.
  2. Click the delete button for that entry.

Deleting an entry removes it from the raffle. Use caution when deleting entries that have been purchased.

docs.title: Raffle List
docs.text:
To view all your raffles:

  1. In the top navigation bar, click Raffles.
  2. You'll see a list of all raffles you've created.

The list shows:

  • Raffle Name – Click to edit the raffle.
  • Event Name – The associated event, if any.
  • URL – The public URL where participants can view and purchase entries.
  • Status – Whether the raffle is active.

docs.title: Pagination
docs.text: If you have many raffles, the list is paginated with 10 raffles per page. Use the pagination controls to navigate between pages.

docs.title: Public Raffle Page
docs.text:
Each raffle has a public URL that participants can visit to:

  • View the raffle details and description.
  • See which entries are available, pending, or purchased.
  • Purchase available entries via PayPal.

The URL follows the format: raffl.online/raffle/[your-unique-url-name]

docs.title: Entry Display
docs.text:
On the public raffle page, entries show:

  • Available entries – Can be claimed and purchased.
  • Pending entries – Currently being purchased (5-minute hold).
  • Purchased entries – Show the buyer's name from PayPal.
  • Sponsored entries – Show the sponsor name you assigned.

docs.title: Sponsor Events
docs.text: Sponsor events allow you to create sponsorship opportunities with a grid-based layout. Each sponsorship space has its own price and can be purchased separately.

docs.title: What are Sponsor Events?
docs.text:
A sponsor event is organized into:

  • Days – Represent columns in your sponsorship grid (e.g., "Friday AM", "Friday PM", "Saturday")
  • Groups – Organize classes into sections (e.g., "Puppy Classes", "Adult Classes")
  • Classes – Represent rows within groups (e.g., "Best Puppy 4-6", "Best of Breed")
  • Sponsorship Spaces – Individual cells at the intersection of a day and class, each with its own price

For example, a dog show might have: - Days: Friday AM, Friday PM, Saturday AM, Saturday PM - Groups: Puppy Classes, Junior Classes, Adult Classes, Senior Classes - Classes: Best Puppy, Reserve Puppy, etc. (within each group) - Sponsorship Spaces: 4 days × 3 classes = 12 sponsorship spaces per group

docs.title: Sponsor Event Workflow
docs.text:
Setting up a sponsor event follows a 4-step workflow:

  1. Event Details – Name, URL, and status
  2. Days – Create columns representing different days or sessions
  3. Groups & Classes – Organize sponsorship spaces into groups and rows
  4. Pricing – Set the price for each sponsorship space

Once setup is complete, the event is published and sponsors can purchase spaces through the public page.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Step-by-step setup – Guided workflow ensures all required fields are completed
  • Flexible pricing – Set different prices for each sponsorship space
  • Offline payments – Override sponsor names for offline payment methods (checks, cash, etc.)
  • PayPal integration – Automatic payment processing with PayPal IPN webhook support
  • Analytics – View visitor counts, daily activity, and sold spaces

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Ready to create a sponsor event? Create a Sponsor Event

docs.title: Step 1: Start a New Sponsor Event
docs.text:
1. In the top navigation bar, click Sponsor Events.
  2. Click Create Sponsor Event to start a new event.

docs.title: Step 2: Event Details
docs.text:
Fill out the following information:

  • Event Name – The name of your sponsor event (e.g., "TDCI 2025 Specialty", "Dog Show Sponsorship")
  • Unique URL Name – A custom URL slug for your sponsor page (e.g., tdci-2025-specialty). This will be used in your public link: /sponsor/your-url-name
  • Event Status – Choose Active to publish the event or Inactive to hide it

Click Edit to save your event details.

!!! note The event is not yet published. You'll need to add days and classes before sponsors can purchase spaces.

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
After creating your event, proceed to:

  1. Add Days – Define the columns (days/sessions) in your sponsorship grid
  2. Add Groups & Classes – Define the rows and organize them into groups
  3. Set Pricing – Set the price for each sponsorship space

Once all three steps are complete, your sponsor event will be ready for sponsors to purchase spaces.

docs.title: Editing Event Details
docs.text:
To return to event details after initial creation:

  1. Navigate to your sponsor event
  2. Click the Event Details tab in the left navigation
  3. Modify any fields and click Edit

You can change the event name, status, and URL at any time.

docs.title: Managing Entries & Payments
docs.text: After your sponsor event is live, you can manage sponsor entries and view payment information.

docs.title: Editing Sponsor Entries
docs.text: Use the Edit Entries tab to manually override or add sponsor names. This is useful for offline payments (checks, cash, etc.).

docs.title: To Edit a Sponsor Entry:
docs.text:
1. Navigate to your sponsor event
  2. Click the Edit Entries tab
  3. Enter or modify the sponsor name in the input field for the desired sponsorship space
  4. Click Save All Entries

docs.title: Entry Status Indicators
docs.text:
Each sponsorship space shows:

  • Filled (green checkmark) – Sponsor name has been entered
  • Price – Shows the price if not yet purchased
  • Free – Shows "Free" if the space has no cost

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
Friday AM    Friday PM    Saturday AM    Saturday PM
Puppy Classes
  Best Puppy      Acme Corp    [empty]    Doggy Treats   Paws & Co
  Reserve Puppy   [empty]      Bark Inc    [empty]        PetLand

docs.title: Offline Payment Workflow
docs.text:
For sponsors paying by check, cash, or other offline methods:

  1. Receive payment from sponsor
  2. Go to Edit Entries tab
  3. Enter the sponsor's name in the appropriate sponsorship space
  4. Click Save All Entries
  5. The sponsor's name will appear on the public sponsor page

docs.title: Viewing PayPal Payment Details
docs.text: View all PayPal transactions for your sponsor event.

docs.title: To View Payment Details:
docs.text:
1. Navigate to your sponsor event
  2. Click the PayPal Details tab

The table displays:

Column Description Item Number PayPal transaction item number Payment Status Status badge (Completed, Pending, etc.) Payment Date Date the payment was received Last Name Buyer's last name First Name Buyer's first name Amount Total amount paid

!!! note Only transactions processed through PayPal appear in this table. Offline payments won't appear here (but will show up in Edit Entries once you add them manually).

docs.title: Metrics & Analytics
docs.text: View sponsorship statistics and activity:

docs.title: To View Metrics:
docs.text:
1. Navigate to your sponsor event
  2. Click the Metrics tab

The dashboard displays:

  • Unique Visitors – Total number of people who viewed your sponsor page
  • Last 7 Days Activity – Graph showing daily visitor counts
  • Total Sponsor Spaces – Total number of sponsorship spaces available
  • Spaces Sold – Number of sponsored spaces (both online and manually added)

!!! tip Use these metrics to track interest in your sponsor event and optimize pricing if needed.

docs.title: Add an Offline Sponsor
docs.text:
1. Receive payment (check/cash)
  2. Go to Edit Entries tab
  3. Find the sponsorship space
  4. Enter sponsor name
  5. Click Save All Entries

docs.title: Correct a Sponsor Name
docs.text:
1. Go to Edit Entries tab
  2. Find the sponsorship space with the incorrect name
  3. Edit the name
  4. Click Save All Entries

docs.title: Remove a Sponsor (Refund)
docs.text:
1. Go to Edit Entries tab
  2. Clear the sponsor name field (leave empty)
  3. Click Save All Entries
  4. Process refund through PayPal or bank (manually)

docs.title: View a Specific Payment
docs.text:
1. Go to PayPal Details tab
  2. Locate the payment by buyer name or date
  3. Note the Item Number for your records

docs.title: Integration with Public Page
docs.text:
Changes you make in the admin panel immediately appear on the public sponsor page:

  • New offline payments show up within seconds
  • Corrected sponsor names update instantly
  • Removed entries are hidden from public view

There's no need to publish or deploy—everything is live in real-time.

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text:
• Sponsorship spaces won't populate? Make sure you've added both days and groups/classes in the setup steps
  • Can't find the Edit Entries tab? You need to complete Steps 1-3 (Event Details, Days, Groups & Classes) first
  • PayPal details missing? PayPal payments sync automatically via webhook; offline payments must be added manually in Edit Entries

docs.title: Setting Sponsor Prices
docs.text: Once you've added days and classes to your sponsor event, you can set the price for each sponsorship space.

docs.title: Accessing the Pricing Tab
docs.text:
1. Navigate to your sponsor event
  2. Click the Pricing tab in the left navigation

!!! note The Pricing tab is only available after you've added at least one day and one group with classes.

docs.title: Price Grid Layout
docs.text:
The pricing grid displays:

  • Rows – Classes, grouped by their group
  • Columns – Days
  • Cells – Individual sponsorship spaces with price input fields

For example:

                Friday AM    Friday PM    Saturday AM    Saturday PM
Puppy Classes
  Best Puppy      $50         $50           $50            $50
  Reserve Puppy   $50         $50           $50            $50

Adult Classes
  Best in Show    $100        $100          $100           $100
  Reserve         $75         $75           $75            $75

docs.title: Setting Individual Prices
docs.text:
1. Click the Pricing tab
  2. Enter the price for each sponsorship space in the input fields
  3. Leave blank or enter 0 for free sponsorship spaces
  4. Click Save All Prices to save your changes

!!! tip Prices can include cents (e.g., $10.50). PayPal fees will be added during checkout.

docs.title: Bulk Price Setting
docs.text:
To set all prices to the same amount:

  1. Click the Pricing tab
  2. Enter a price in the "Set All Prices To..." field
  3. Click Set All Prices To...
  4. Click Save All Prices

This is useful when you want a uniform price across all sponsorship spaces.

docs.title: Editing Prices Later
docs.text:
You can change prices at any time, even after sponsors have purchased spaces:

  1. Navigate to your sponsor event
  2. Click the Pricing tab
  3. Modify the prices
  4. Click Save All Prices

!!! note Price changes only affect new purchases. Previously sold spaces keep their original price.

docs.title: Dog Show Sponsorship
docs.text:
Specialty Show (4 days × 3 classes per group × 2 groups = 24 spaces)

Puppy Classes
  Best Puppy      $50         $50           $50            $50
  Reserve Puppy   $25         $25           $25            $25

Adult Classes
  Best in Show    $100        $100          $100           $100
  Reserve         $50         $50           $50            $50

docs.title: Mixed Pricing
docs.text:
Premium days (weekend) at higher prices
Economy days (weekday) at lower prices

docs.title: Free vs. Paid Spaces
docs.text:
You can mix free and paid spaces:

  • Enter 0 or leave blank for free spaces
  • Enter a price for paid spaces
  • Sponsors will see which spaces are free vs. paid on the public page

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
After setting prices, your sponsor event is ready for sponsors to purchase spaces!

Check the Metrics tab to view: - Number of visitors - Daily activity - Total sold spaces - Revenue

For managing offline payments and viewing PayPal transactions, see Managing Entries & Payments.

docs.title: Setting Up Days, Groups & Classes
docs.text:
After creating a sponsor event, you need to set up the structure of your sponsorship grid:

  1. Days – Columns representing different days or sessions
  2. Groups – Sections that organize classes (e.g., "Puppy Classes")
  3. Classes – Individual rows within groups (e.g., "Best Puppy", "Reserve Puppy")

docs.title: Adding Days
docs.text: Days represent the columns in your sponsorship grid (e.g., "Friday AM", "Friday PM", "Saturday").

docs.title: To Add a Day:
docs.text:
1. Click the Days tab in the left navigation
  2. Click + Add Day
  3. Enter the following:
  4. Date – The date of the day/session (optional, but recommended)
  5. Description – How the day will be labeled in the grid (e.g., "Friday AM", "Round 1")
  6. Click Add Day

The day will appear in the table. You can add multiple days.

docs.title: To Edit a Day:
docs.text:
1. In the Days table, modify the description or date directly in the input fields
  2. Click Save

docs.title: To Delete a Day:
docs.text:
1. Click the Delete button next to the day
  2. Confirm the deletion (this will also delete all sponsor spaces associated with that day)

!!! warning Deleting a day will remove all sponsorship spaces for that day, even if they've been sold. Use with caution.

docs.title: Adding Groups & Classes
docs.text: Groups organize classes into sections. Each group can contain multiple classes. Classes represent the rows in your sponsorship grid.

docs.title: To Add a Group:
docs.text:
1. Click the Groups & Classes tab in the left navigation
  2. Click + Add Group
  3. Enter the Group Name (e.g., "Puppy Classes", "Adult Classes")
  4. Click Add Group

The group will appear as a collapsible accordion section.

docs.title: To Add a Class:
docs.text:
1. Click the Groups & Classes tab
  2. Expand the group where you want to add a class
  3. In the "Classes in this group" section, enter the Class Name (e.g., "Best Puppy", "Best of Breed")
  4. Click + Add Class

docs.title: To Edit a Group or Class:
docs.text:
1. In the Groups & Classes tab, click the Edit Groups & Classes section
  2. For Group Name: Modify the text field next to the group and click Save
  3. For Class Name: Modify the text field next to the class and click Save

docs.title: To Delete a Group or Class:
docs.text:
1. Click the Delete Group or Delete button
  2. Confirm the deletion

!!! warning Deleting a group or class will remove all sponsorship spaces associated with it. Use with caution.

docs.title: Understanding Sponsorship Spaces
docs.text:
When you add days and classes, the system automatically creates sponsorship spaces for each combination.

For example: - If you have 4 days and 3 classes in a group, you'll have 12 sponsorship spaces (4 × 3) - Each space can be purchased independently and have a different price

You can view the total number of sponsorship spaces in the Pricing tab.

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
• Add Days First – Start by adding all your days/sessions
  • Then Add Groups & Classes – After days are complete, add groups and classes
  • Finally Set Prices – Once all spaces exist, set individual prices in the Pricing tab

!!! tip The step-by-step navigation highlights which steps are required and prevents you from setting prices until both days and classes exist.
